abstract.p: Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-Shing plans to create large publicly owned company in Canadian oil sector--Husky Energy Inc--by merging privately held Husky Oil Ltd with Renaissance Energy Ltd, both of Calgary; Husky Oil will pay equivalent of 19.40 Canadian dollars in cash and stock for each Renaissance share, total of 2.8 billion Canadian dollars ($1.9 billion); shareholders of Renaissance will own 35 percent of new company and current owners of Husky Oil will own 65 percent; photo (S)

block.p: The Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-Shing plans to create a large publicly owned company in the Canadian oil sector -- Husky Energy Inc. -- by merging the privately held Husky Oil Ltd. with Renaissance Energy Ltd., both of Calgary. Husky Oil will pay the equivalent of 19.40 Canadian dollars in cash and stock for each Renaissance share, a total of 2.8 billion Canadian dollars ($1.9 billion). Shareholders of Renaissance will own 35 percent of the new company and the current owners of Husky Oil will own 65 percent. The Li family owns 49 percent of Husky Oil directly and controls the remaining 51 percent.
